title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 December 2014 - XWiki
content:

09:25 <vmassol> good morning  
09:25 <vmassol> I'm workng on fixing http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-watchlist-test-tests/567/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.watchlist.test.ui/WatchThisPageAndWholeSpaceTest/testWatchThisPageAndWholeSpace/  
09:43 <vmassol> fixed

10:00 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <tmortagne> has quit  
10:05 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <tmortagne> has quit  
10:07 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <tmortagne> has quit  
10:21 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:45 <vmassol> Enygma`: good morning, we need to release asap :) Also see my email on the list that I've just sent  
10:47 <Enygma`> Hi vmassol  
10:47 <Enygma`> on it  
10:47 <vmassol> FYI guillaume is having internet connection issues  
10:47 <vmassol> and he's switching offices but he won't be here before this afteroon  
10:47 <Enygma`> AFAIK, on the test side, the biggest part was the email related ones  
10:47 <vmassol> he also told me that he's not committing the less4j stuff since there are isseus  
10:48 <tmortagne> has quit  
10:48 <Enygma`> platform had 1 test and UI had about 9 tests failing  
10:48 <Enygma`> email related  
10:48 <vmassol> Enygma`: I fixed platform  
10:48 <evalica> I still need to fix the menu - with the changes he did - so I need to find a solution before releasing  
10:48 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:49 <vmassol> evalica: hope you can do this quickly this morning so that we could release in the afternoon  
10:49 <vmassol> please all check the email I've just sent on the list  
10:50 <vmassol> (it's important re releases)  
10:52 <evalica> vmassol: the major problem with all this proposal is that people will not be here, so I don't see how this is an 'improvement' and how it makes things done  
10:53 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:54 <Enygma`> was thinking the same... adding 2 more weeks during the holiday season does not do much for us, except for extending the RC1 to 1 week after the holidays  
10:54 <Enygma`> leaving us with practically 1 week of development to push into RC1, which I am not sure is enough not appropriate for an RC release :/  
10:54 <vmassol> "us" = ?  
10:55 <vmassol> it does help for the xwiki project  
10:55 <vmassol> if that's "us"  
10:55 <Enygma`> yes, the XWiki project will have 90+% of its committers on holidays during the entire 6.4M3 dev period  
10:55 <Enygma`> right?  
10:55 <vmassol> is "us" = caty + edy and you're taking 2 weeks of holidays then you need to explain what you want to propose  
10:55 <vmassol> no  
10:56 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <vmassol> with this proposal we're already 3 weeks late compared to the plan that's already not acceptable  
11:07 <Slashman> has quit  
11:08 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:14 <lucaa> has quit  
11:29 <ClemensR> hm, seems I cannot add pages to my watchlist without editing them in flamingo, it seems ... or I am just missing that button :)  
11:30 <ClemensR> ah, it is only on xwiki.org where the button is missing ...  
11:30 <ClemensR> correction, it is only on subwikis ... I guess that is a known issue ....  
11:33 <Enygma`> has quit  
11:36 <vmassol> hmm doesn't ring a bell  
11:36 <vmassol> (ClemensR)  
11:36 <tmortagne> ClemensR: yes I think it's because watchlist hasn't been installed on some subwikis  
11:37 <ClemensR> I better test locally, but e.g. Icannot place http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DocGuide on my watchlist .... ah, thats why  
11:37 <tmortagne> because of the not perfect custom XAR extension used in xwiki.org  
11:37 <ClemensR> ah, ok, that explains it ...  
11:37 <tmortagne> I fixed it in some wikis, all it need is installing watchlist extension usually  
11:37 <tmortagne> checking dev  
11:39 <tmortagne> should be ok on dev now  
11:40 <tmortagne> if you have the issue on other wikis just install watchlist ui 6.2.2  
11:41 <vmassol> working on fixing InvitationTets now  
11:42 <vmassol> ok foudn the problem  
11:42 <vmassol> err not yet ;)  
11:49 <ClemensR> tmortagne: yes, works now, thanks :)  
11:57 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:33 <Lyes> has quit  
14:08 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
14:14 <Rick\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:20 <Rick\_> has quit  
14:25 <vmassol> \_cjd: hi  
14:25 <\_cjd> good afternoon  
14:25 <vmassol> any idea why in InvitationConfig we have a SMTP config instead of using the wiki config?  
14:26 <vmassol> I added some config options to the general smtp config  
14:26 <\_cjd> we probably had a desire to allow invitations to be sent through a different smtpd  
14:26 <vmassol> really?  
14:26 <\_cjd> anyway it falls back on the default iirc  
14:26 <vmassol> hmm by default it's filled with some values  
14:26 <vmassol> maybe there's a flag to tell it to use it or not  
14:27 <vmassol> rying to find the code that sends email  
14:27 <\_cjd> in retrospect it seems like silly over-design, but one never knows in advance what will  
14:27 <vmassol> InvitationCommon probably, checking  
14:27 <\_cjd> either that or WebHome  
14:28 <vmassol> inded I see that in webhome: #sendMail($messages, $config, $emailContainer)  
14:28 <vmassol> and the macro is defined inwbehome too  
14:29 <vmassol> ok I've seen the logic  
14:29 <vmassol> so since there are default values  
14:29 <vmassol> the general ones won't be used  
14:29 <vmassol> for server and port  
14:31 <vmassol> anyway, I think it needs to be removed in the future and we should use the new mail sender api  
14:31 <\_cjd> sounds logical  
14:31 <vmassol> i'd rather add the ability to define several mail configurations in the generic mail config  
14:31 <vmassol> and provide an id for the various configs  
14:32 <vmassol> rather than have extensions redefine all the params  
14:32 <vmassol> (if we need several configs)  
14:32 <\_cjd> I don't think it's realistic to have multiple servers, it was just something that "sounded important" in the heat of the moment  
14:32 <vmassol> which I didn't take into accout as a use case when I did the new mail sender api  
14:32 <vmassol> ok  
14:35 <vmassol> created XWIKI-11577 to rememerb it  
14:45 <vmassol> ok found the problem, fixing  
14:50 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
14:58 <vmassol> Enygma`: tests should be fixed now  
15:00 <vmassol> sorry for not noticing earlier  
15:05 <Denis1> has quit  
15:05 <vmassol> guys several the jobs for 6.3 are fialing on ci, should we just remove the 6.3 branch?  
15:05 <vmassol> same question for 6.2.x branch  
15:10 <tmortagne> if we don't plan to release another 6.2.x  
15:10 <tmortagne> I doubt we want to release 6.3.1 (even if there is a few blockers fixed)  
15:18 <vmassol> 6.2.x we should probably keep as a safety till we release 6.4 and till 6.4 is proven stable  
15:18 <vmassol> but 6.3.x I think we could remove it now  
15:30 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
15:56 <Enygma`> just started a build of xwiki-platform, since due to the jenkins instability that was just fixed, the latest 2 commits on platform were not built  
16:03 <gdelhumeau> can I commit?  
16:04 <gdelhumeau> Enygma`?  
16:05 <Enygma`> I`m planning to release. I`ve launched this build to see if all tests pass. If you commit now, I`ll have to wait again, so please don`t  
16:05 <gdelhumeau> ok so for M3  
16:48 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
16:56 <msmeria> has quit  
17:15 <vmassol> tmortagne: you might be interested by https://twitter.com/infinispan/status/545610409882169344  
17:18 <tmortagne> vmassol: 6.x was pretty much complete already but yes even better if certified  
17:51 <Lyes> has quit  
17:55 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:57 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: why do you have clirr excludes inside the lesscss module?  
17:58 <gdelhumeau> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/pom.xml#L514  
17:59 <Enygma`> o... k  
17:59 <Enygma`> would be useful to also say what the bug is  
17:59 <Enygma`> but should not impact this release

20:43 <Enygma`> having trouble doing release:perform on platform  
20:43 <Enygma`> http://hastebin.com/usivuwofit.coffee  
20:43 <Enygma`> vmassol: any chance you`re online at this hour?  
22:04 <vmassol> Enygma`: any problem?  
22:04 <Enygma`> vmassol: yeah, one after another...  
22:05 <Enygma`> first I had this http://hastebin.com/usivuwofit.coffee and apparently this https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/28f7e067f933e31ec7cec1ce3afee07aaf51f1d4 fixed it (hopefully)  
22:05 <vmassol> ok, I wonder why this is a problem now  
22:05 <Enygma`> 10 minutes ago I got this http://hastebin.com/oduxuxugay.m  
22:06 <Enygma`> and now I`m re-running the release for the nth time this evening  
22:06 <Enygma`> it is running now, but not sure for how long  
22:06 <vmassol> k  
22:06 <Enygma`> platform seems to be the most problematic  
22:06 <vmassol> crossing fingers for you  
22:06 <Enygma`> yeah, thanks  
22:06 <vmassol> strange though  
22:07 <vmassol> going back to my dinner (celebrating christmas in advance with part of the family ;))  
22:07 <Enygma`> heh, sounds fun  
22:07 <Enygma`> enjoy!  
22:07 <vmassol> bbl to check in case you need my help  
22:07 <vmassol> good luck  
22:08 <Enygma`> I think I`ve passed the latest failure, looking good :)  
22:08 <Enygma`> thanks :)  
22:21 <Enygma`> yet another failure  
22:21 <Enygma`> [ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin:6.4-milestone-2:package (default) on project xwiki-platform-watchlist-test-tests: Execution default of goal org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin:6.4-milestone-2:package failed: Plugin org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin:6.4-milestone-2 or one of its dependencies could not be resolved: Could not find artifact org.opensymphony.quartz:quart  
22:21 <Enygma`> it`s the maven download issue apparently  
22:22 <Enygma`> re-re-re-restarting the platform release...  
22:45 <Enygma`> platform passed, finally  
23:27 <vmassol> has quit
